Member Function Documentation

virtual USocket* UUnixSocket::acceptClient (  )  [inline, virtual]

This method is called to accept a new connection on the server socket. Further communications on the newly connected socket are made via the newly created USocket instance of which a pointer is returned when the connection is accepted. We create a USocket instance and pass this to the base class accept() method to accept the pending connection on this USocket instance

Reimplemented from USocket.

USocket * UUnixSocket::acceptClient ( USocket *  pcNewConnection  )  [virtual]

This method is called to accept a new connection on the server socket. Further communications on the newly connected socket are made via the newly created USocket instance of which a pointer is returned when the connection is accepted. We create a USocket instance and pass this to the base class accept() method to accept the pending connection on this USocket instance

int UUnixSocket::recv ( void *  pBuffer,
int  iBufLength 
) [virtual]

This method is called to receive a block of data on the connected socket. The parameters signify the payload receiving buffer and its size.

Reimplemented from USocket.

int UUnixSocket::send ( const void *  pPayload,
int  iPayloadLength 
) [virtual]

This method is called to send a block of data to the remote connection. The parameters signify the Data Payload and its size.

Reimplemented from USocket.

bool UUnixSocket::setServer ( int  port,
int  iBackLog 
) [virtual]

A Unix domain "server" is created as a Unix domain socket that is bound to a pathname and that has a backlog queue to listen for connection requests.

Reimplemented from USocket.
